Change Log - Version 1.1.GA

Bug

  • [BPEL-200] - Redeployment of a changed PAR (with modified .bpel) requires App Server Restart
  • [BPEL-230] - store element properties in a VARCHAR column instead of LONGVARCHAR for oracle compatibility
  • [BPEL-231] - integration service opens request listeners even if tx marked for rollback
  • [BPEL-232] - Missing "description" property in BpelDefinition mapping
  • [BPEL-242] - <scope> not allowed to enclose a start activity
  • [BPEL-250] - NPE when deploying a process using jbpm-bpel.jar from BPEL-230
  • [BPEL-256] - First activity of a flow has to have a defined target even if the containing flow element has a target
  • [BPEL-258] - non-start activities within initial flow are never entered
  • [BPEL-260] - Flow activity might not reactivate parent token in race condition
  • [BPEL-264] - NPE when dead-path elimination reaches a flow with local links
  • [BPEL-265] - structured activities tell they are initial even if they are the targets of links
  • [BPEL-267] - NPE extracting content from soap envelope containing default namespace declarations
  • [BPEL-271] - NPE when a start IMA references a nonglobal variable
  • [BPEL-278] - role referenced in <from> is not verified to exist in the partner link

Feature Request

  • [BPEL-59] - get original BPEL document after deployment
  • [BPEL-204] - Add org.jbpm.webapp.servlet.UploadServlet as part of the bpel distribution.
  • [BPEL-245] - make xpath function library extensible
  • [BPEL-259] - upgrade to hibernate 3.2.4.SP1
  • [BPEL-269] - enhance assignment logging capabilities
  • [BPEL-272] - allow xpath expression/query to create more than one occurrence of an element
  • [BPEL-279] - variable variant is not supported in predicate
  • [BPEL-282] - Engine runs process instances in serie instead of in parallel
  • [BPEL-286] - SOAP Communication Exceptions should be catchable inside the process

Task

  • [BPEL-86] - Release jBPM BPEL 1.1
  • [BPEL-190] - webservice descriptors generation tool
  • [BPEL-216] - Fully automated process deployment
  • [BPEL-217] - convert bpel-definition.xml into master wsdl document
  • [BPEL-218] - introduce a central service catalog
  • [BPEL-229] - move to a portable deployment model
  • [BPEL-233] - Simplify activity XML readers
  • [BPEL-234] - Convert Invoker, Receiver, Replier and Alarm into Actions
  • [BPEL-235] - Revise NodeCollection view of CompositeActivity subclasses
  • [BPEL-236] - Convert QNameType from UserType to CompositeUserType
  • [BPEL-237] - Remove unnecessary persistent extensions of WSDL4J classes
  • [BPEL-238] - Upgrade to jPDL 3.2.GA
  • [BPEL-239] - detect and deal with jpdl deployments
  • [BPEL-240] - upgrade bpel 1.1 compensate to bpel 2 compensate/compensateScope
  • [BPEL-241] - provide a compensation example
  • [BPEL-243] - throw selectionFailure when copying from an element with xsi:nil=true
  • [BPEL-249] - create ws stack integration subprojects
  • [BPEL-251] - cover document-style bindings in service generation tool
  • [BPEL-253] - Skip service/artifact generation tools if sources have not changed
  • [BPEL-254] - Fix namespace URIs and schema locations of definition and application descriptor schemas
  • [BPEL-255] - Update the namespace URI of variable property elements
  • [BPEL-257] - rename correlation patterns
  • [BPEL-261] - use varbinary instead of varchar as data type to store dom elements
  • [BPEL-262] - redeliver messages whose handling fails due to stale state exceptions
  • [BPEL-263] - incorporate enterprise support features from jpdl
  • [BPEL-266] - incorporate targetNamespace in process definition versioning
  • [BPEL-270] - Add support for extensionAssignOperation
  • [BPEL-273] - provide a declarative way to install new evaluator factories in the sublanguage framework
  • [BPEL-274] - wsdl service generator: eliminate reliance on transitive imports
  • [BPEL-275] - web module deployment tool
  • [BPEL-276] - generate bpel application descriptor along with wsdl service description
  • [BPEL-280] - redeploy web modules upon server restart
  • [BPEL-281] - ant tasks for process deployment
  • [BPEL-283] - process deployment from web console
  • [BPEL-284] - document new deployment model
